purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the representation of information needed to manage the life cycle process of developing and using a system such that qualified persons and organizations can be assigned to projects.

This module captures information concerning organizations and persons associated with those organizations along with useful relationships to experience and qualifications. That information is needed to manage the life cycle process of developing and using a system such that qualified persons and organizations can be assigned to projects.
This module is constructed from several ISO/TS Application modules:
The module captures the definition of the types of organizations of interest in project management.

The module captures the definition of approval, certification, classification, contract, date, timing, documentation, effectivity, identification, justification, language, reference data, and security data to product and activity data.

inscope.li: definition of type of organization and relationship between two organizations;
definition of position type in organization;
relationship between position, person and organization;
identification of experience and qualification of person an organization;
identification and association of experience, qualifications and position with person an organization.

outscope.li: association of person an organization with activity or product data;
identification and characterization of person an organization associated schedule;
identification and characterization of person an organization associated work;
identification and characterization of person an organization associated project breakdown;
identification and characterization of person an organization associated project management information resources;
the relationships between project breakdown and project management information resources, schedule and work structure.
